page.title: 14HISTORIC PLACES 2
page.content: {EASTHAMPSTEAD PARK} Present mansion built 1868.In C16th it was used as a Royal hunting lodge and was enlarged over the centuries.Cath- erine of Aragon spent her last years here after her divorce from HenryVIII. The lodge became a mansion and was given by Charles I to William Trumbell It remained in his family for 200 yrs. when the Downshires took residence.In 1864 a new red brick mansion was built north of the old house.This was later pulled down except for the stables which still stand in the grounds of the Downshire Golf Course and are now houses and flats. {CAESAR'S CAMP Built sometime between 300BC & 40AD this had nothing to do with Caesar but was built by the Celts.It is a hill fort and the Roman road from London to Silchester ran to the south.
